content.description: start on the flakey jug to the right of the arete, climb up about two feet then traverse to the arete and continue up to a finish on the slopey topout.
content.location: from main cliff line downhill to the left.

content.description: A small left facing dihedral that leads to a 10' roof.
content.protection: a fixed nut is in the corner just below the roof. a #.5,#.75, #1, #2, and a #3 should protect the entire route, but be sure to sling the first couple of pieces to reduce drag.
content.location: from the trail that leads down go right and stay on the main cliff till you come to a waterfall and cave. the route will be on the right side of the cave

content.description: Crux is a dyno to a jug off of small crimps. You definitely do not want to fall once you pull the lip.
content.location: Starts in the same crack as “Cool as the Wind” on the Dungeon Boulder. Moves up the crack before traversing left across the highball face on small crimps and dynoing to a jug at the left end of the face. From their you pull the lip to a super highball slab to top out.

content.description: Start on the arete "cow nose," of two small dish jugs at chest level, throw directly upward and right on decent jugs and work your way up to an amazing sidepull just left of the arete and make a slightly reachy traverse move up and right to a small jug protrusion. From there find decent feet and make a move to the sloper knob directly above. The crux is getting established on the sloper-pinch and committing to a small circular pocket up and to the right. After getting a good (but high) foot, you can shoot to the top for a ledge. Topout is flat and was last cleaned in 2016 but is still decent.
content.location: Located at the beginning  of the main cliff line. The right-most arete before you get to the main area. If you see bolts on the wall, you've gone too far.

content.description: Large pocket climb with a positive crimp before a slopey top out. Sit start with both hands on the large pocket to the right, and follow the other pockets to a reachy move to a positive crimp, then a decent sloper to top out.
content.protection: Use a crash pad on the rock closest to the boulder, and watch out for the 3ft drop off to the left of the route.
content.location: From the main cliff line walk approx 150 ft (along cliff line) and go directly down hill until you see the boulder that looks as though it's been shot at with a shotgun.

content.description: A small cliff line with some sport climbs, boulder problems and some trad lines. None are taller than about 30' but some lines are super easy and a few are like bolted boulder problems.
